jexample.internal
Class MethodCollector

java.lang.Object
  jexample.internal.MethodCollector

public class MethodCollector
extends java.lang.Object

The MethodCollector class collects all Method's involved in a test run.

Author:
Lea Haensenberger (lhaensenberger at students.unibe.ch)

Method Summary
 java.util.Map<java.lang.reflect.Method,TestMethod> collectTestMethods()
          All Method's are collected in a non-recursive way, so no endless-loop is risked.

Constructor Detail

MethodCollector

public MethodCollector(TestClass testClass,
                       java.util.Map<java.lang.reflect.Method,TestMethod> alreadyCollectedMethods)
Parameters:
testClass - the TestClass the Method's have to be collected from
alreadyCollectedMethods - a Map of already collected Method's, e.g. when a TestSuite is run
Method Detail

collectTestMethods

public java.util.Map<java.lang.reflect.Method,TestMethod> collectTestMethods()
                                                                      throws java.lang.SecurityException,
                                                                             java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                                                             java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
All Method's are collected in a non-recursive way, so no endless-loop is risked. For all Method's of this.testClass is checked, whether the dependencies are already collected. If not, they are processed in a second loop and so on, until there are no new Method's to process anymore.

Returns:
a Map with all the collected Method's as keys and TestMethod's as values in it
Throws:
java.lang.SecurityException
java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
